thread.title: Chris Long gave a shout out to St. Louis after winning Super Bowl LI
thread.title_full: Chris Long gave a shout out to St. Louis after winning Super Bowl LI

title: Chris Long gave a shout out to St. Louis after winning Super Bowl LI
text:
Chris Long gave a shout out to St. Louis after winning Super Bowl LI Chris Long gave a shout out to St. Louis after winning Super Bowl LI By Tanya Ray Fox 6 hours ago 522 shares By: Tanya Ray Fox | 6 hours ago 
  defensive end Chris Long received a lot of attention throughout the 2016 season for his vocal enthusiasm about finally being part of a winning culture in New England with the Patriots. 
After failing to make the playoffs in his eight seasons with the Rams, Long hit free agency and immediately set his sights on a team with whom he could play “meaningful football” games. Related: Ex-Rams DE Chris Long happy to play in meaningful games in New England 
On Sunday, with over 100 million people watching, Long won the most meaningful football game of his career and possibly the greatest football game in the history of the NFL. 
The Patriots overcame a 25-point deficit to win Super Bowl LI on the first possession in overtime, making history on several fronts and securing their fifth title in 15 years. Related: Chris Long on playing for Patriots: 'I would have played this year for five dollars' 
After some hearty celebration, Long took to Twitter to thank the fans of Boston. He also remembered to shout out St. Louis, a city that is left without an NFL team and was incredibly supportive of his move to the Patriots. For my old friends in StL, I felt the love tonight and I will always appreciate y'all. 
— Chris Long (@JOEL9ONE) February 6, 2017 
In the locker room after the win, Long spoke a bit about his journey from the Rams to the Patriots: Chris Long @JOEL9ONE on going from so much losing with #Rams to winning it all #SB51 #Patriots #superbowl51 pic.twitter.com/nUa7p327xv 
— Ben Boyd (@BenBoydKMOX) February 6, 2017 
At the end of the season, only one team’s fan base is exultant. Everyone else is left to build up hope for next year. 
However there are still many Rams fans who were happy to see Long have his moment, even if he did it while wearing the despised Patriots uniform. People are mad cause I'm a Rams fan and wanted the patriots to win!! Chris long deserves it that's my only reason
